original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—

original: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:

original: Āyasmā sāriputto etadavoca:

translated: “Friends, four kinds of persons are found existing in the world.

original: Katame cattāro?
analyzed: katame cattāro
translated: What four?

original: Idhāvuso, ekacco puggalo sāṅgaṇova samāno ‘atthi me ajjhattaṁ aṅgaṇan’ti yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti.
analyzed: idha āvuso ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ sa aṅgaṇaḥ uva samānaḥ atthi me ajjhattam aṅgaṇam ti yathābhūtam na ppajānāti
translated: Here, a certain person, though himself full of hate, does not perceive this thus: ‘I am full of hate.’

original: Idha panāvuso, ekacco puggalo sāṅgaṇova samāno ‘atthi me ajjhattaṁ aṅgaṇan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: idha pana āvuso ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ sa aṅgaṇaḥ uva samānaḥ atthi me ajjhattam aṅgaṇam ti yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: Here, a certain person, though himself full of hate, perceives this thus: ‘I am full of hate.’

original: Idhāvuso, ekacco puggalo anaṅgaṇova samāno ‘natthi me ajjhattaṁ aṅgaṇan’ti yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti.
analyzed: idha āvuso ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ anaṅgaṇaḥ uva samānaḥ natthi me ajjhattam aṅgaṇam ti yathābhūtam na ppajānāti
translated: Here, a certain person, though himself free from hate, does not perceive this thus: ‘I am free from hate.’

original: Idha panāvuso, ekacco puggalo anaṅgaṇova samāno ‘natthi me ajjhattaṁ aṅgaṇan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: idha pana āvuso ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ anaṅgaṇaḥ uva samānaḥ natthi me ajjhattam aṅgaṇanti yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: “There is the case where a certain person is without internal enemies. He discerns, as it actually is, that ‘I am without internal enemies.’

original: Tatrāvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo sāṅgaṇova samāno ‘atthi me ajjhattaṁ aṅgaṇan’ti yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti, ayaṁ imesaṁ dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ sāṅgaṇānaṁyeva sataṁ hīnapuriso akkhāyati.
analyzed: tatra āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ sa aṅgaṇaḥ uva samānaḥ atthi me ajjhattam aṅgaṇanti yathābhūtam na pajānāti ayam imesam dvinnam puggalānam satam hīna purisaḥ akkhāyati
translated: “The person who, while having internal enemies, does not discern, as it actually is, that ‘I have internal enemies’ is called the lowest of those with internal enemies.

original: Tatrāvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo sāṅgaṇova samāno ‘atthi me ajjhattaṁ aṅgaṇan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ayaṁ imesaṁ dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ sāṅgaṇānaṁyeva sataṁ seṭṭhapuriso akkhāyati.
analyzed: tatra āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ sa aṅgaṇaḥ uva samānaḥ atthi me ajjhattam aṅgaṇanti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam imesam dvinnam puggalānam sa aṅgaṇa anayā iva satam seṭṭha purisaḥ akkhāyati
translated: “The person who, while having internal enemies, discerns, as it actually is, that ‘I have internal enemies’ is called the highest of those with internal enemies.

original: Tatrāvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo anaṅgaṇova samāno ‘natthi me ajjhattaṁ aṅgaṇan’ti yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti, ayaṁ imesaṁ dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ anaṅgaṇānaṁyeva sataṁ hīnapuriso akkhāyati.
analyzed: tatra āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ anaṅgaṇaḥ uva samānaḥ natthi me ajjhattam aṅgaṇanti yathābhūtam na pajānāti ayam imesam dvinnam puggalānam satam hīna purisaḥ akkhāyati
translated: “The person who, while without internal enemies, does not discern, as it actually is, that ‘I am without internal enemies’ is called the lowest of those without internal enemies.

original: Tatrāvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo anaṅgaṇova samāno ‘natthi me ajjhattaṁ aṅgaṇan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ayaṁ imesaṁ dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ anaṅgaṇānaṁyeva sataṁ seṭṭhapuriso akkhāyatī”ti.
analyzed: tatra āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ anaṅgaṇaḥ uva samānaḥ natthi me ajjhattam aṅgaṇanti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam imesam dvinnam puggalānam satam seṭṭha purisaḥ akkhāyati iti
translated: The one who is without blemish and who understands as it really is: ‘I am without blemish,’ is the better of the two.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā mahāmoggallāno āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ āyasmantam sāriputtam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Ven. Mahā Moggallāna said to Ven. Sāriputta,

original: “Ko nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, hetu ko paccayo yenimesaṁ dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ sāṅgaṇānaṁyeva sataṁ eko hīnapuriso akkhāyati, eko seṭṭhapuriso akkhāyati?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho āvuso sāriputta hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena imesam dvinnam puggalānam sa aṅgaṇā anayā iva satam ekaḥ hīna purisaḥ akkhāyati ekaḥ seṭṭha purisaḥ akkhāyati
translated: “What, my friend Sāriputta, is the reason why, of these two people with blemish, one is declared to be a lesser person and one a superior person?

original: Ko panāvuso sāriputta, hetu ko paccayo yenimesaṁ dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ anaṅgaṇānaṁyeva sataṁ eko hīnapuriso akkhāyati, eko seṭṭhapuriso akkhāyatī”ti?

translated: What, my friend Sāriputta, is the reason why, of these two people without blemish, one is declared to be a lesser person and one a superior person?”

original: “Tatrāvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo sāṅgaṇova samāno ‘atthi me ajjhattaṁ aṅgaṇan’ti yathābhūtaṁ

original: nappajānāti, tassetaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ—na chandaṁ janessati na vāyamissati na vīriyaṁ
analyzed: na ppajānāti tassa etam pāṭikaṅkhana chandam janessati na vāyamissati na
translated: It can be expected that he will not arouse desire to act, will not make an effort,

original: ārabhissati tassaṅgaṇassa pahānāya;🔽so sarāgo sadoso samoho sāṅgaṇo saṅkiliṭṭhacitto kālaṁ karissati.

translated: will not instigate energy to give up that hidden flaw.🔽He will die with lust, hatred, and delusion, with hidden flaws, with a soiled mind.

translated: “Yes, friend.”🔽“So too, a person who has a hidden flaw,

analyzed: evam eva kho āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ sa aṅgaṇaḥ uva samānaḥ atthi me ajjhattam aṅgaṇanti

analyzed: tatra āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ sa aṅgaṇaḥ uva samānaḥ atthi me ajjhattam aṅgaṇa nti yathābhūta

analyzed: pajānāti tassa etam pāṭikaṅkha chandam janessati vāyamissati vīriyam ārabhissati
